(Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR LOS ANGELES (AP) — The father of fashion models Bella and Gigi Hadid has been fined and given community service for illegally building a gigantic mansion in Los Angeles. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Los Angeles Times reports (http://lat.ms/2ufqHY5 ) that real estate developer Mohamed Hadid was sentenced Thursday to 200 hours of service, fined $3,000 and ordered to pay the city more than $14,000 to cover building department costs. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hadid pleaded no contest in May to misdemeanor charges for building portions of a 30,000-square-foot mansion in Bel Air without obtaining proper permits. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Authorities say bedrooms, decks, supporting walls and even an IMAX theater were built illegally. The city halted construction three years ago and the home remains unfinished. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hadid's attorney, Robert Shapiro, said after sentencing that Hadid is interested in bringing the home into compliance and completing it. ago (http://lat.ms/2ufqHY5 in The LOS attorney, at festival — fined The were city ) for misdemeanor 30,000-square-foot Press)
